lead_paragraph: Edmonton re-signed goaltender Dwayne Roloson to a three-year, $11 million deal and forward Fernando Pisani to a four-year contract worth $10 million. Roloson carried the Oilers through the first three rounds of the playoffs before hurting his knee in Game 1 of the Stanley Cup finals. Pisani, an Edmonton native, scored 37 points in the regular season and 14 goals in the playoffs.
